|iso15924=Glag }}

The 'Glagolitic alphabet' , also known as Glagolitsa, (OCS: , ) is the oldest
known Slavic alphabet from the 9th century. The name was not coined until many
centuries after its creation, and comes from the Old Church Slavonic
[[wikt:â°â°â°â°â°â°â°|glagolÑ]] "utterance" (also the origin of the Slavic name for the
letter G). The verb glagoliti means "to speak". It has been conjectured that the
name glagolitsa developed in Croatia around the 14th century and was derived
from the word glagolity, applied to adherents of the liturgy in
Slavonic. Bernard Comrie and Greville G. Corbett, The Slavonic Languages,
Taylor & Francis, 2002, p. 29.
